item.title: Wine Talk:Dreaming under the Tuscan sun
item.description:
Wine Talk:Dreaming under the Tuscan sun

Throughout history, Jews have made wine at home out of necessity. They needed wine so they could sanctify festivals and Shabbat. Jewish and kosher wine was really a cottage industry throughout the ages. Wine was made in buckets and bathtubs or any receptacle that was available, from local table grapes to raisins.

item.title: Cellar Collections
item.description:
Cellar Collections

Stemmler 2013 Pinot Noir, Sonoma Coast "Medium ruby in color, with expressive aromas of blackberry, kirsch, cherry, watermelon and pencil lead. The palate shows bright cherry and raspberry, with fresh plum and spice notes on the finish. Earthy yet juicy, this supple Pinot shows wonderful finesse and depth."

item.title: Can't Miss Wine Events: CabFest, Flavor!, Festival Napa Valley, Bottega Gran Fondo | Stark Insider
item.description:
Can't Miss Wine Events: CabFest, Flavor!, Festival Napa Valley, Bottega Gran Fondo | Stark Insider

Spring is just about here, and with summer just around the corner it can only mean one thing: the Stark Insider calendar is filling up with a tonne of can't miss food and wine events across the Napa Valley. All of them - so far - feature familiar faces ( CabFest and Flavor!

item.title: Red, Red Wine
item.description:
Red, Red Wine

click to enlarge Napa Valley and Cabernet Sauvignon go together like Seattle and coffee, like Kentucky and bourbon. With that in mind, the team behind the Napa Valley Performing Arts Center at Lincoln Theater in Yountville is hosting its third annual CabFest Napa Valley to celebrate the rich flavor of Cabernet Sauvignon and the community that creates it.

item.title: The 2014s are 'silky, full-bodied and sexy'
item.description:
The 2014s are 'silky, full-bodied and sexy'

There's no better way to judge a wine vintage in the Napa Valley than to ask those who made it. The recent Premiere Napa Valley 2016, which culminated with an auction of 226 wine barrel futures at the Culinary Institute of America at Greystone, was the perfect opportunity to talk to a lot of winemakers.

item.title: The Coolest New Destination in Napa Valley is in Yountville

item.title: Drink In the Downton Abbey Finale | Wine Enthusiast Magazine
item.description:
Drink In the Downton Abbey Finale | Wine Enthusiast Magazine

The curtains will close on PBS's beloved British soap opera Downton Abbey on March 6, and if you're longtime fans like us, you'll need a drink in order to cope. Throughout the lavishly costumed series, which chronicles 14 years of upper-crust intrigue on an aristocratic English estate, drinks have played a central role-so much that a Downton Abbey-inspired wine collection was released in 2013 and expanded last year.
